newsitem.title: GERMANY: German charged with spying for Syria.
newsitem.headline: German charged with spying for Syria.

text.p: Germany's state prosecutor has charged a Syrian man given German citizenship in 1994 with intimidating and spying on Syrians, Lebanese and Palestinians, the prosecutor's office said on Monday.

The man, identified only as Ali Mohamad H., has lived in Germany since 1986 and is accused of working for the Syrian secret service Mukhabarat Al Askarya, spying on figures suspected of "anti-Syrian activities".
To recruit informants the 40-year-old man offered rewards or, in the case of refusal, threats against those targeted or their relatives in Syria.

He passed on the information they supplied to his partners in the Syrian embassy in Bonn, the prosecutor's office said. In one case, the information he passed on led to the arrest of one person on a trip back home to Syria.
The indictment alleges the man built up a network of informants in Germany. He has been in custody since June this year.
